answers.answer: My boy is also measuring two weeks ahead. Doc reckons it won't have much effect on the expected due date.

My baby measures roughly 4 weeks ahead but everything is fine so no induction for me. I got tested for diabetes and was told that if I had it I would be induced no later than 38 weeks for babies health si I would assume you would be induced around then.

I also have GD baby has been measuring 2 weeks ahead at 20 week scan and 4 weeks ahead at 32 weeks have anothwr on friday to find out how much bigger he has gotten my consultant told me with Gd they look to induce between 37-39 weeks but wint donit just on the size of baby alone so u may be lucky fingers crossed they tell me i can go in next week so uncomfy hope all goes well for you x
Late ultrasounds tend to be really off. I just wouldn't pay attention to it.
Thanks ladies that all makes me feel way better!

question: I'm measuring two weeks ahead and getting an ultrasound at my next appointment to check on our baby boy. Anybody measure ahead and either had to or didn't have to get induced early because of it? I'm trying  to figure my odds and get a perception of what might have to happen. Background info is I have gestational diabetes. I wasn't measuring ahead the whole pregnancy I just started measuring two weeks ahead when I went to my 34 week appointment. So I'm just wondering anybodies experiences who can try and help me get some perception. Thank you!
title: anybody wanna share?
